title: Plate
provenance: formerly in the collection of Rev. Alfred Duane Pell, [this information by way of George B. McClellan, 14, December, 1938].
description:
flat bottom; slightly cavetto marly decorated with concentric bands of wreath enclosing a peacock on cylindrical vessel, flanked by armorial devices - caption below, in Gothic letters: Les Repas de Chevalerie - pendant to 1938-57-319, -320, to -324, -326, to -330 - compare with: 1936-13-14.
porcelain decorated in yellow, green, red and brown with gilding
name: Plate
